text:
Hey there! I have this flow I want to implement:

• Create a contact
• Check if a company with a certain property already exists (let's say the property is our production's db group Id for said user)
    ◦ If it exists, then associate the contact with it
    ◦ If it does not, then create a company and associate the contact
I cracked the create a contact part using the `crm.companies.simplePublicObjetctInput` method, but the second part had me stuck. I was browsing the python SDK's source code and found <https://github.com/HubSpot/HubSpot-api-python/blob/master/HubSpot/crm/contacts/models/simple_public_object_with_associations.py|an input method with associations> but couldn't find examples of how to fetch the required ids. Thanks a lot in advance :slightly_smiling_face:

I am sure there is people here that would give an upvote to this idea: <https://community.HubSpot.com/t5/HubSpot-Ideas/Ability-to-create-a-Code-API-documentation-section-articles-in/idi-p/541732#M99378>
